title: Zed's a high skill ceiling champ, but I feel his kit is graceful for bad players.
body:
I can always tell the good zed players from the bad ones.  The good ones will throw their shadow at you, switch places and use auto attack e and q very quick and ult if he's not fed enough. Bad zed players just ult e q and press r again.

i'm not saying good zed players won't start ult, because there are plenty of places to start with ult, such as under tower. But bad zed's will almost always start r anywhere. on the map. Problem is how forgiving zed's kit is to such players.

Again I'M NOT SAYING GOOD ZED PLAYERS DON'T START R.

Edit: I think some of you don't under the term skill ceiling. Think of it like a piano player. You can be bad, average, and expert. Average and expert pianists can most likely play a simple song flawlessly. But only experts will play the most difficult songs because that's how far they've taken their skill. Zed is that champ that is a simple song.

Well it's no secret that artificial damage sources have gotten out of hand, and no champion is better at abusing them than Zed: Duskblade, Electrocute and lesser runes are potent enough on their own and absolutely bonkers once 25-55% damage amplification comes into play. It's hard to have respect for Zed 100-0'ing someone when he doesn't even have to land Q anymore to do that.
Add ultra-safe laning phase to that and easy-mode lasthitting due to his passive and you got yourself a hero with extremely low skillcap. Yes, he has a high skill ceiling but you dpn't need to have Challenger-level mechanics in order to win games. You merely need to perform decently - and "just" performing decently on Zed is almost braindead easy.

With a comment that elaborate and backed up with facts and math I have no choice but to concede that I'm wrong...
